The IMO has so far not addressed the possibility of offsetting greenhouse gas emissions from ships with carbon capture ashore.

site_title: Abu Dhabi to invest in startup Archer’s air-taxi operations in the UAE
summary: Abu Dhabi's Abu Dhabi Investment Office has agreed to invest hundreds of millions of dollars in Archer Aviation's air-taxi operations in the UAE, with a plan to develop local manufacturing and operations. The deal includes capital contributions and financial subsidies for production and related activities. Archer will establish its international headquarters in Abu Dhabi, with partnerships with local operators and a route between Abu Dhabi and Dubai's Palm Jumeirah. The investment aims to accelerate the company's commercial air taxi operations in the region, ahead of planned launches in 2025.

site_title: In the robot-driven Fifth Industrial Revolution, human-centric skills remain key
summary: In the Fifth Industrial Revolution, humans and robots collaborate, prioritizing social well-being. Artificial intelligence (AI) plays a crucial role in detecting and preventing cyber threats, such as phishing scams, by analyzing vast amounts of data. However, it's human understanding and emotional intelligence that ultimately prevent scams, as they can recognize and counter fear tactics and behavioral strategies. This synergy between humans and AI is key to achieving industrial and enterprise transformation while maintaining social well-being.

images.alt_text: Financial advisers occupy a unique position within the wealth management market, serving as the nexus between individuals and numerical analysis.
The US Copyright Office has rejected various copyright applications for art created using AI. “Human creation” is required for something to qualify as a piece of authorship deserving of protection.

site_title: Air China orders homegrown C919s in challenge to jet duopoly
summary: Air China has ordered 100 Comac C919 airliners, valued at $10.8 billion, in a challenge to the commercial aircraft duopoly held by Airbus and Boeing. Deliveries will start this year and run through 2031. The move follows previous orders from China Eastern Airlines and Suparna Airlines, and marks a significant push by China into the lucrative market for larger commercial airliners.

images.alt_text: Comac has so far put the narrow-body C919 (above) and regional jet ARJ21 into commercial operation, but its long-haul wide-body programme has experienced delays
A China's Comac C919 aircraft performs during a preview of the Singapore Airshow in Singapore on February 18, 2024. (Photo by Roslan RAHMAN / AFP)
A C919 performs during a preview of the Singapore Airshow in Singapore on Feb 18.

site_title: Bad blood with China? Blinken buys Taylor Swift album in Beijing
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken unexpectedly stopped at a Beijing record store, purchasing Taylor Swift's 2022 album "Midnights" alongside a classic Chinese rocker Dou Wei's album. The detour occurred after talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping aimed at easing superpower tensions. Blinken emphasized the importance of "people-to-people ties" in improving relations, highlighting the significance of music as a connector across geography. The visit marked a rare moment of levity during a tough diplomatic trip.

images.alt_text: China's President Xi Jinping (C) holds a meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken (3rd L) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on April 26, 2024. (Photo by Mark Schiefelbein / POOL / AFP)
US Secretary of State Antony Blinken (left) shakes hands with China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi (right) during a meeting at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse in Beijing, China, April 26, 2024.
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will press China to stop its firms from retooling and resupplying Russia’s defence industrial base.

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, on his second trip in less than a year to China, has also accused Beijing of fueling the Ukraine war by supplying components to Russia which it uses for its military expansion - claims Beijing condemned Tuesday as “groundless”.

site_title: Equities still best for riding the tech wave
summary: Wealth and investing expert Bjorn Jesch from DWS notes that despite a significant interest rate hike cycle, equities remain the best vehicle for riding the tech wave, with a reduced risk premium and favorable prospects for growth. However, he cautions that the future interest rate path remains uncertain and that economic growth prospects are meager, with only slight acceleration expected. Jesch recommends a diversified portfolio, favoring telecommunications services, consumer discretionary sectors, and alternative investments such as bonds and gold.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor as screens display the logo for Chevron Corp. and Hess Corp. at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York City, U.S., October 23, 2023.  REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

site_title: HSBC wins £1.3 billion suit over Disney film finance scandal
summary: HSBC successfully defended itself in a £1.3 billion lawsuit over tax breaks linked to Walt Disney film financing. The bank was accused of misleading investors over the Eclipse Partnerships, which promised backing for films like Pirates of the Caribbean 2. However, a London court ruled that while investors suffered significant losses, they could not prove HSBC and its bankers acted dishonestly. The court found the bank did not mislead investors, allowing the case to be dropped.

images.alt_text: Disney’s annual meeting, when voting will end, is scheduled for April 3.

FILE PHOTO: A screen shows the logo and a ticker symbol for The Walt Disney Company on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., December 14, 2017. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

site_title: What to do when you’ve been de-banked
summary: Banks are increasingly closing client accounts due to the stringent regulatory environment, with 343,350 accounts closed in the UK in the 2021-22 financial year. A "broad brush" approach is being applied, with groups of customers de-banked rather than individuals assessed on a case-by-case basis. Banks use technology to detect suspicious activity and are required to refresh "know your client" files. Individuals can take steps to rebuild their "bankability" by conducting a public records search, addressing "red flags" and compiling a factual narrative explaining their background and source of wealth. Seeking professional help is also recommended to maintain robust relationships with banks and other stakeholders.

images.alt_text: Property agents and observers The Business Times spoke to said that existing anti-money laundering measures may not be foolproof, even after property agents conduct checks.
Interpol has observed an “explosion” of cyber-enabled crime in recent years, says secretary-general Jurgen Stock.
The Financial Conduct Authority headquarters in London on July 6. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg

site_title: Keppel prices 70 million euros of floating-rate notes due 2031
summary: Keppel, a Singaporean asset manager, plans to issue 70 million euros (S$102.2 million) in floating-rate notes due 2031. The notes will bear interest at a floating rate based on the Euro Interbank offered rate, and net proceeds will be used for general corporate and working capital purposes. The issue is part of Keppel's US$5 billion multi-currency medium term note programme, and the notes are expected to be issued on or around May 8.

images.alt_text: Higher net property income was mainly due to higher rentals as well as contributions from 2 Blue Street, said the Reit’s manager.
Shares in Genting Singapore were  per cent lower after news that Malaysia is looking at opening a casino in Johor.

site_title: Yeo Guat Kwang, John Chen retiring from corporate boards
summary: Former Singapore MP Yeo Guat Kwang and Dr. John Chen are retiring from corporate boards. Yeo, a lead independent non-executive director of water purification company SIIC Environment, will step down at the company's upcoming AGM due to a new listing rule requiring independent directors to surrender their status after nine years. Dr. Chen, executive chairman of Pavillon Holdings, will also retire and be given the title of chairman emeritus. Raymond Lye, a PAP candidate, has been appointed as Wee Hur's independent director.

images.alt_text: John Lim, the past chairman of the Singapore Institute of Directors, introduced the changes to the Asean Corporate Governance Scorecard at the SGX auditorium on Tuesday (Jan 23).
While regulators and experts in the field often focus on the minutiae of rules and controls that guide the behaviour of companies, ordinary investors often react to the behaviour itself.
Table, chairs, meeting room
SGX RegCo's stiffening regulatory attitude is unlikely to be popular among corporate boards
The Singapore Exchange (SGX) centre taken on January 8, 2020.
Singapore has a longstanding issue with independent directors who simply would not leave.

Previously, long-serving IDs (LSIDs) could continue to be deemed independent if approval was obtained at two tiers of voting: first, from all shareholders; and second, from shareholders excluding directors, the CEO and their associates.

site_title: HCA beats first-quarter profit estimates on higher patient admissions
summary: HCA Healthcare, the largest US for-profit hospital operator, reported a 6.2% increase in same-facility admissions and a 7.2% increase in emergency room visits in the first quarter, beating estimates. The company posted an adjusted profit of $5.36 per share, exceeding expectations of $5.01 per share. Revenue reached $17.34 billion, surpassing estimates of $16.78 billion. Despite this, HCA reaffirmed its annual forecast. Analysts attribute the demand for medical care to a healthy population and a shift towards ambulatory care centers.

site_title: F&B operator YKGI to exclusively operate Chicha San Chen in Macau for next eight years
summary: YKGI, a food and beverage operator, has secured an exclusive 8-year agreement to operate Chicha San Chen in Macau, starting from April 26, 2024. The company has a master franchise agreement with Fang Yuan F&B International, the franchisor of the bubble tea chain, which originated from Taiwan. This move follows a non-binding overseas authorization memorandum signed in September 2023. YKGI will manage Chicha San Chen in Macau, marking the brand's expansion into the region.

site_title: Singapore must prepare for slower growth at higher costs: MAS
summary: Singapore's economy is expected to transition to a slower long-run growth path with higher costs, according to the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). The country's growth rate will largely depend on total factor productivity (TFP) gains, and wages and prices may rise more quickly than in other countries. This shift is due to resource constraints and cost increases, which will challenge Singapore's ability to sustain growth without a commensurate increase in unit labour cost.

images.alt_text: Recent high-frequency data suggests continued resilient economic growth in 2024, where a 3 per cent expansion is expected, MAS said.

site_title: WTO countries to reboot dispute reform negotiations
summary: The World Trade Organization (WTO) is resuming negotiations on reforming its dispute settlement system by the end of this year. Ambassador Usha Dwarka-Canabady from Mauritius has been appointed as the chief negotiator, replacing the previous facilitator Marco Molina. The talks aim to replace and reform the appeals bench, which has been mothballed since 2019 due to opposition from the US. The US delegate welcomed the appointment, stating that the US remains committed to continuing an interest-based approach to the discussions. The consultations will identify priority issues for future discussions.

images.alt_text: The recent 13th ministerial meeting of the World Trade Organization struggled mightily without doing anything of significance, despite going into overtime.

site_title: Seatrium unit to fully redeem S$500 million worth of floating-rate bonds early
summary: Seatrium Offshore & Marine has given notice to bondholders of its S$500 million floating-rate bonds, aiming to fully redeem the bonds prior to the scheduled maturity date of May 27, 2026. The early redemption is part of the company's capital management efforts to optimise its borrowing cost and debt profile. The move is expected to have no material adverse effect on its financial position or business operations.

images.alt_text: Seatrium has a slew of products and revenue streams – oil products, jack-ups, FPSO systems, as well as the renewable offshore platform space.
Analysts see light at the end of the tunnel as the company leaves the spectre of large write-downs and lawsuits behind.

site_title: Sri Lanka to hand management of China-built airport to India, Russia companies
summary: Sri Lanka is handing over the management of its Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport, a US$209 million Chinese-built airport, to Indian and Russian companies, Shaurya Aeronautics of India and Airports of Regions Management Company of Russia, for 30 years. The move aims to reduce financial losses from the airport, which has been plagued by low flights, environmental concerns, and financial struggles. Sri Lanka is also renegotiating its US$4.2 billion loan with China Exim Bank to restructure the airport's debt.

images.alt_text: Jet fuel aside, Sri Lanka is running short of other supplies needed for daily living. They were waiting in line last week (above) on a pavement near a distributor to buy kerosene oil for their cookers amid the country's economic crisis.

site_title: LMIRT Q1 net property income dips 3.1% to S$30 million on higher expenses
summary: LMIRT, a Singapore retail trust, reported a 3.1% decline in net property income to S$29.9 million for Q1, driven by higher property operating and maintenance expenses and lower impairment loss reversal. Gross revenue rose 0.7% to S$49.2 million, while rental revenue fell 0.9% to S$27.5 million due to a depreciation in the Indonesian rupiah. The trust will focus on addressing its maturing debt obligations and continue to exercise prudence on distributions.

images.alt_text: Figures released by the Urban Redevelopment Authority on Friday (Apr 26) showed that prices of retail space increased by 1.8 per cent, extending a 1.2 per cent increase in Q4.

Mapletree Industrial Trust’s aggregate leverage ratio rose to 38.7 per cent as at March 2024, up from 37.4 per cent a year earlier. Interest coverage ratio, meanwhile fell to 4.6 times from 5 times over the same period.

site_title: China central bank flags bond investment risks to some financial institutions: sources
summary: China's central bank has informed some financial institutions to reduce their bond duration and focus on core businesses due to interest rate risks, following a record-breaking rally in Chinese treasuries. The People's Bank of China (PBOC) has warned that long-dated bonds' yields are too low, reflecting future economic growth prospects. The move aims to prevent risks associated with aggressive bond buying by rural commercial banks, which has seen yields on 30-year bonds drop over 35 basis points this year.

images.alt_text: Beijing has announced plans to step up central government spending as an offset.
Investors have piled into bonds due to a variety of factors including China’s dovish monetary policy, haven demand from local institutions and a shortfall in debt supply.
China's treasury bond market, now the third-largest globally, boasts improved liquidity, facilitating the central bank's secondary market transactions.
China’s central bank has not made a significant bond purchase since 2007.

site_title: Indian central bank issues draft guidelines for web aggregators of loan products
summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released draft guidelines for a regulatory framework for web aggregators of loan products, aiming to enhance transparency and inform borrowers about potential lenders. Banks and non-banking finance companies (NBFCs) must ensure their lending service providers (LSPs) provide a digital view of loan offers from willing lenders, including the lender's name, loan amount, and terms. The LSPs must also ensure the content is unbiased and not promotional in nature. Comments on the draft circular are invited by May 31.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A Reserve Bank of India (RBI) logo is seen inside its headquarters in Mumbai, India, April 6, 2023. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas/File Photo

site_title: Royal rides: Super wheels in Malaysian King’s luxe garage
summary: Malaysia's King Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar has a collection of over 300 luxury cars, including the first privately owned Hongqi L5 luxury sedan, valued at around $957,537. The ultra-luxury sedan, produced by China's oldest automotive brand, was presented to the king in April. Other notable vehicles in his collection include a Rolls-Royce Phantom VI, a Bugatti Veyron, a replica Flintmobile, and a custom-made Mack Super-Liner Sleeper truck. The king's passion for automobiles has drawn attention to his vast and impressive collection, solidifying his status as a member of the royal family.

images.alt_text: Malaysian King Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar has a collection of at least 300 luxury cars.

site_title: Huawei’s smart car tech offers automakers route to China sales
summary: Huawei has rapidly emerged as a major player in smart car technology, developing advanced driving assistance systems (ADAS) that are being adopted by several Chinese automakers. The company's Qiankun system is being featured in at least seven Chinese cars, including those from Volkswagen, Audi, and Nissan. Huawei aims to become a top-tier automotive supplier, competing with established companies like Bosch and Continental. The company's growth in the industry is seen as a strategic move to offset the impact of US export controls on its smartphone business.

images.alt_text: Visitors look at screens that demonstrate Huawei's intelligent driving software Qiankun, at its booth during the Beijing International Automotive Exhibition, or Auto China 2024, in Beijing, China, April 25, 2024. REUTERS/Tingshu Wang
Huawei has enjoyed a resurgence since the Mate’s August debut.
On Tuesday, Huawei unveiled the S9 sedan, the first model under the premium Stelato brand it launched with Baic.
The Biden administration is considering blacklisting Chinese companies it suspects could make chips for Huawei.

site_title: Thames water crisis risks £100 billion UK investment plan
summary: The UK's Thames Water is facing a debt crisis that jeopardizes a £100 billion investment plan to repair Britain's crumbling utilities infrastructure. Shareholders refuse to inject more capital, and the government insists taxpayer money shouldn't be used to resolve the crisis. The government is considering a debt restructuring, which could involve writedowns on bonds of up to 40% and taking the company into temporary government ownership. This could increase borrowing costs for the water sector and affect the UK's overall infrastructure investment.

images.alt_text: Moody’s says it downgrads Thames Water (Kemble) Finance – which is effectively a holding company for the utility – to B2 from B1 and maintains a negative outlook.

site_title: Berjaya founder Vincent Tan denies casino plan in Malaysia’s Forest City
summary: Malaysia's Forest City development, a $100 billion project, is facing revitalization efforts. Berjaya Corp's founder Vincent Tan denies plans to build a casino in Forest City, contradicting a report that suggested the Malaysian government was considering a second casino license to revive the project. Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim also denied the report. Experts weigh the potential economic benefits against social costs, with some suggesting a casino could boost tourism and government revenue, while others express concerns about the impact on the local community and religion.

images.alt_text: This is the second time for Country Garden to stretch payments on the three bonds, which were issued by its main onshore unit.
The RTS Link development has been seen as a game-changer to Malaysia and Singapore, the project is expected to complete in end-2026.
Genting controls Malaysia’s only casino and operates Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), one of two integrated resorts in Singapore.

site_title: Chevron's quarterly profit beats estimates
summary: Chevron reported adjusted earnings of $2.93 per share for the first quarter, beating analysts' estimates of $2.87. The company's US production increased 35% from last year, driven by the acquisition of PDC Energy and strong execution in the Permian and DJ Basins. Net oil-equivalent production rose 12% to 3.34 million barrels per day. Despite rising geopolitical tensions, global oil prices remained range-bound. Chevron's CEO Mike Wirth attributed the success to sustained project milestones.

images.alt_text: Chevron says it has conducted its “exit from Myanmar in a responsible, orderly and safe manner, in accordance with international law and trade sanctions”.

site_title: US: Wall St opens higher
summary: US stocks opened higher on Friday, April 26, driven by a boost from megacaps following Alphabet's robust quarterly results, which pushed its market value over $2 trillion. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 28.9 points, or 0.08%, to 38,114.7, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also increased, with the Nasdaq rising 1.34% to 15,821.335. The gains were partly attributed to a calm inflation print and reduced concerns about elevated interest rates.

site_title: Daily Debrief: What Happened Today (Apr 26)
summary: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) upgraded its expectations for Singapore's growth to around its potential rate of 3% in 2024, citing resilient economic growth. Industrial production contracted 9.2% in March, driven by declines in electronics and biomedical sectors. Private home prices rose 1.4% in Q1, while HDB resale prices accelerated to 1.8% due to stronger demand. Asia markets ended mixed, awaiting further macroeconomic data and inflation concerns.

site_title: HSBC’s private bank shuts independent asset management business in HK, Singapore
summary: HSBC's private bank has shut its independent asset management business in Hong Kong and Singapore following a strategic review. The move, effective immediately, will make the transition as smooth as possible for affected clients. The bank, which previously set up independent asset management desks in 2020 in Singapore and 2022 in Hong Kong, remains committed to serving single and multi-family offices. The decision is seen as part of HSBC's broader pivot to the region, amid increasing scrutiny of banks in Singapore and Hong Kong.

site_title: Singapore factory output reverses into negative territory in March, down 9.2%
summary: Singapore's factory output contracted 9.2% year on year in March, falling below private sector economists' expectations of a 1.5% contraction. This reversal came after a revised figure of 4.4% growth in February. Excluding the volatile biomedical manufacturing cluster, factory output fell 5.9% year on year. The decline was driven by double-digit declines in the electronics and biomedical clusters.

images.alt_text: The linchpin electronics sector improved by 0.4 point in March, posting a faster expansion at 50.8 and staying in expansion territory for the fifth consecutive month.

site_title: Exxon misses on Q1 profit despite big gains in Guyana
summary: ExxonMobil reported Q1 earnings of $8.22 billion, down 28% from the same period last year, missing analyst estimates. Weaker refining margins and lower natural gas prices offset volume gains, while the chemicals business saw earnings more than double. The company attributed the miss to tax and inventory balance sheet adjustments. Exxon's Guyana operations contributed to the increase in output, and the company expects to reach 2 million barrels per day in 2027 following its acquisition of Pioneer Natural Resources, set to wrap up in coming weeks.

images.alt_text: California’s investigation focused on what it had called a “half-century campaign of deception” by fossil fuel companies such as ExxonMobil who perpetuate “myths around recycling.
Darren Woods, chairman and CEO of ExxonMobil was awarded almost 200 times the median pay for an Exxon worker, despite this increasing 8 per cent last year to US$185,376.

site_title: EU toughens rules on Chinese fashion retailer Shein
summary: The European Union has added Chinese-founded online retailer Shein to its list of 23 "very large online platforms" subject to stricter safety curbs under the Digital Services Act. From August, Shein will have to apply the tougher rules, joining other platforms like Facebook, TikTok, and YouTube. The designation follows Shein's over 45 million monthly active users in the EU.

images.alt_text: Shein has successfully penetrated a global market that spans over 150 countries, but concerns have been raised about its business practices and ethics.
What sets Shein apart from rivals is a hyper-efficient supply chain and product development process, analysts say.
Shein is seeking Beijing’s nod to go public in a listing that will likely face tough scrutiny from US regulators.

site_title: Best World under fire from shareholders at AGM over dividends, director salaries
summary: Best World International, a beauty product distributor, faced scrutiny from shareholders at its first in-person annual general meeting (AGM) in five years. Shareholders questioned the lack of dividend payouts and the compensation of directors, with some describing the pay as "quite high." The company has proposed a selective capital reduction, offering S$2.50 per share, and has decided to delist due to short-selling and increasing risks in the China market. The company plans to engage shareholders further on the matter and obtain approval for the delisting at an EGM.

images.alt_text: Navene Elangovan
全美世界（Best World International）总部外观。
Best World says it will take no further action relating to the Mar 21 requisition letter.

site_title: Vietnam delays launch of new stock trading system
summary: Vietnam has delayed the launch of its new stock trading system, initially set for May 2, due to regulatory roadblocks and readiness issues. The system, provided by the Korea Exchange, aims to speed up transaction settlement and upgrade the country's stock market. The delay affects Vietnam's efforts to reclassify itself as an emerging market, as it currently remains classified as a frontier market, limiting investment opportunities. The new system's launch date remains uncertain, with the State Securities Commission providing no new timeframe.

images.alt_text: Nearly 900 students from other South-east Asian countries are enrolled at Singapore Management University.
The new system will handle the settlement of transactions within a day, speeding up operations and facilitating trading, especially short selling.
The price of gold bars in the South-east Asian country has gained around 15 per cent this year.

site_title: Asia: Markets rise as strong US tech earnings offset poor data
summary: Asia markets rose on Friday, driven by strong US tech earnings from Microsoft and Alphabet, despite worries about a potential US economic slowdown and stagflation. Hong Kong, Seoul, and Taipei markets gained over 1%, while Tokyo, Shanghai, Singapore, and Manila also rose. However, losses in Sydney, Wellington, and Jakarta were offset by gains from tech firms across the region. Investors await the release of the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge and the Bank of Japan's decision on interest rates, which could impact the economic outlook.

images.alt_text: Across the broader market, losers outnumber gainers 62 to 45.
The Stoxx 600 index closed 0.7 per cent lower on Thursday, after shedding as much as 1.3 per cent intraday, in line with a global stocks rout.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished at 38,085.73 on Thursday, down 1.0 per cent but about 330 points above its session low.

site_title: Outgoing Singapore, Indonesia leaders to hold their final retreat in Bogor on Apr 29
summary: Singaporean Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong and Indonesian President Joko Widodo will meet for their final retreat on April 29 in Bogor, marking the last time they will discuss bilateral cooperation. The leaders will endorse agreements in defence, the digital economy, and sustainability. This meeting comes as Lee is set to hand over the premiership to Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong on May 15, and Widodo will end his second term in office in October. The retreat will also review significant progress made in areas such as trade, investment, and healthcare.

images.alt_text: Singapore’s Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong  (2nd L) and his spouse Ho Ching (L) are welcomed by Indonesia’s President Joko Widodo (2nd R) and First Lady Iriana Widodo upon their arrival for the ASEAN Summit in Jakarta on September 5, 2023.     ADEK BERRY/Pool via REUTERS

As the first country in Asean to forge a trade deal with the European Union and, more notably, the first to be negotiating a digital trade agreement with the bloc, Singapore shines as a beacon of success in EU-Asean relations.
The Jakarta Composite index last traded 1.7 per cent higher after earlier hitting an over one-month peak, and was inching toward the record high of 7,403.578 points hit in January.

Analysts expect staples such as food and beverages as well as fast-moving consumer goods to benefit the most from measures introduced by the government to preserve the purchasing power of low to middle-income families.
Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh announced the US$15.5 billion Resource Mobilisation Plan on the sidelines of the COP28 climate talks.

site_title: Issue 97: Chipping away at huge adaptation gap; OUE Reit’s highly ambitious new targets
summary: Standard Chartered estimates that investing $30 billion in adaptation by 2030 in 10 emerging markets could yield more than 12 times in economic benefits. This is based on a study that suggests such investments could help close the huge adaptation gap. OUE Reit has set ambitious new targets for sustainability, aiming to reduce its environmental footprint.

site_title: Country Garden plans to present debt revamp plan in H2, sources say
summary: Country Garden, China's largest private developer, plans to present a debt restructuring proposal to offshore creditors in the second half of 2024, aiming to avoid a liquidation order. The move comes after the company defaulted on $11 billion in offshore bonds and faces a liquidation petition in Hong Kong. A successful restructuring would help the developer push back against the liquidation petition, which could worsen the outlook for China's property sector.

images.alt_text: This is the second time for Country Garden to stretch payments on the three bonds, which were issued by its main onshore unit.

site_title: China’s Bank of Communications Q1 profit rises 1.44%
summary: China's Bank of Communications reported a 1.44% rise in Q1 net profit to 24.99 billion yuan (S$4.7 billion), driven by a 0.36% increase in net interest margin. The bank's non-performing loan ratio was 1.32% at the end of March, down from 1.33% last year. The results come amid a slowing economy, with China's lenders facing shrinking profitability due to reduced interest rates and falling lending demand.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A man walks past an office of Bank of Communications in Beijing, China, August 27, 2020. REUTERS/Thomas Peter/File Photo

site_title: K-pop agency Hybe’s internal strife wipes out 1.2 trillion won
summary: Hybe, a K-pop agency, has experienced internal strife that has led to a 5.8% drop in its shares, wiping out 1.2 trillion won (S$1.2 billion) of market value. The company's CEO, Min Hee-jin, of label Ador, is under investigation for allegedly attempting to seize control of the label. Min denies the allegations, but Hybe has urged her to resign. Despite the turmoil, a forthcoming album from NewJeans, a popular band under Hybe, will launch as planned. The company's management has been questioned, with suspicions about its ability to manage its multi-label system becoming dominant.

images.alt_text: BTS agency, HYBE, said it filed a complaint against Min Hee-jin (above), the chief of its subsidiary label ADOR, which manages mega-popular girl group NewJeans, for breach of trust in business.
UOB's card spending and customer acquisition are boosted by its partnerships with various music acts, including Ed Sheeran.
Hybe, based in Seoul, has been releasing more English songs for K-pop bands and promoting artists including Jung Kook in the United States.

site_title: A brave new whirl in Beijing
summary: China's auto industry has flipped the script on its relationship with foreign car companies, with new Chinese brands sprouting up and dominating the market. At the Beijing auto show, 87 global premieres from local car companies and 30 more from foreign players showcased the shift. Established manufacturers like Mercedes-Benz are partnering with Chinese firms, such as Geely, to relaunch brands like Smart. New Chinese brands, including Haval and Wey, are establishing themselves with popular models like the H9 and #5. The industry's center of gravity is shifting from West to East, with China's massive market driving growth and export.

images.alt_text: Cycle & Carriage Singapore has been appointed distributor of Smart cars and will begin sales in 20254 with the Smart 1 sport utility vehicle.
Mercedes-Benz handled the design of the Smart #1, though the engineering comes from China automotive giant Geely.

site_title: From Klopp to Slot, weary Liverpool head for uncertain future
summary: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk believes Feyenoord manager Arne Slot's philosophy and playing style could make him a future Liverpool coach. The Reds' hopes of winning the English Premier League title have faded after a 0-2 loss to Everton, leaving them third in the table and three points behind leaders Arsenal. Liverpool are now uncertain about their future after Jurgen Klopp's departure, with Slot widely seen as the frontrunner to replace Klopp as manager in the summer.

Soccer Football - Premier League - Everton v Liverpool - Goodison Park, Liverpool, Britain - April 24, 2024

site_title: Indonesia spices up the global interest rate debate
summary: Indonesia's central bank, Bank Indonesia, raised interest rates by a quarter point to 6.25%, aiming to stabilize the country's faltering currency, the rupiah. The move was seen as a surprise and a response to the US Federal Reserve's hawkish stance, which may further pressure Asian currencies. The rupiah has declined 5% this year and 2% since April, and Indonesia's growth target of 8% may be impacted by the rate hike, which could limit growth and jeopardize some economic gains.

images.alt_text: A man holds his new Rupiah bank notes, to be given to family members during the Eid festival which marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan, in Jakarta on March 28, 2024. (Photo by Adek BERRY / AFP)
Bank Indonesia (BI) raised the seven-day reverse repurchase rate by 25 basis points to 6.25 per cent, its highest since the bank made the instrument its main policy rate in 2016.

site_title: Xi tells Blinken US, China should be 'partners, not rivals'
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping told US Secretary of State Antony Blinken that the two countries should be "partners, not rivals," amid ongoing tensions. Xi acknowledged "positive progress" since his meeting with US President Joe Biden last year but emphasized the need to resolve differences on issues like Russia, Taiwan, and trade. The US has raised concerns about China's support for Russia, while China has warned against US pressure that could trigger a "downward spiral" in relations.

images.alt_text: China's President Xi Jinping (C) holds a meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken (3rd L) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on April 26, 2024. (Photo by Mark Schiefelbein / POOL / AFP)

site_title: Nomura Q4 net profit jumps almost eight-fold on retail income surge
summary: Nomura Holdings, Japan's largest brokerage and investment bank, reported a 670% surge in quarterly net profit to 56.8 billion yen (S$493.39 million) compared to a year earlier. The bank's retail and investment banking income reached their highest levels in eight years, driven by a Japanese stock market rally that pushed the Nikkei 225 index to a record high. Despite a decline in global fee pools, Nomura's investment banking revenue rose to its highest since 2016/17. The results mark the bank's continued recovery after it slashed profit targets last May amid global market uncertainty.

site_title: China passes tariff law as tensions with trading partners simmer
summary: China has passed a Tariff Law, effective December 1, allowing it to retaliate with tariffs on imports and exports if its trading partners impose tariffs. The law is part of Beijing's efforts to consolidate trade defense capabilities amid rising tensions with the US and EU. China's industrial overcapacity has led to concerns over cheap products flooding the EU market, prompting Brussels to investigate potential tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles. The law's passage is seen as a deterrent, with analysts comparing it to a "nuclear weapon" to be used to counter potential tariffs.

images.alt_text: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken (left) shakes hands with China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi (right) during a meeting at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse in Beijing, China, April 26, 2024.
Huawei has enjoyed a resurgence since the Mate’s August debut.

site_title: Not just fun and games: How mobile games have become big business
summary: The mobile gaming market dominated global video game spending in 2023, accounting for 56% of total worldwide consumer spending, worth around $108 billion. Companies are finding innovative ways to engage consumers and generate revenue, but this ease of spending raises concerns about mounting costs for consumers, prompting regulators to take notice.

site_title: DigitalBridge-backed Vantage said to weigh Hong Kong data centres sale
summary: Vantage Data Centers, backed by DigitalBridge Group, is considering the sale of its Hong Kong data centers, valued at US$300-500 million. The company operates data centers for technology firms in the Asia-Pacific region, including Singapore. The assets were acquired from PCCW in 2021. Deliberations are ongoing, and a decision could be made to keep the assets or sell them. The sale is part of Vantage's efforts to expand in other markets and comes after a US$6.4 billion equity investment in its Europe, Middle East, and Africa operations.

images.alt_text: CSE group managing director Lim Boon Kheng expects the project to contribute positively to CSE’s financial performance for the 2024-2025 financial years.

It is estimated that by 2030 AI will contribute US$96 billion to the UAE’s economy and US$135 billion to Saudi Arabia’s.

site_title: Indonesia’s push for regional economic integration to continue under Prabowo: Vivian Balakrishnan
summary: Singapore Minister for Foreign Affairs Vivian Balakrishnan has reaffirmed the country's commitment to regional economic integration with Indonesia, particularly in the tech ecosystem. During a four-day working visit to Jakarta, Balakrishnan met with Indonesian President-elect Prabowo Subianto, emphasizing the importance of bilateral relations and cooperation in the region. The two countries aim to connect their tech ecosystems and facilitate investments in productive sectors, including the green economy and digital front. This move is seen as a continuation of Indonesia's push for regional economic integration, with Singapore standing as the top foreign investor in Indonesia.

images.alt_text: Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong with Indonesian President Joko Widodo at the Singapore-Indonesia Leaders' Retreat on Mar 16, 2023.

site_title: Blinken meets Chinese counterpart Wang Yi in Beijing
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Beijing on April 26, 2024, for talks on complex issues including China's backing of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Despite stabilizing ties, Wang expressed concerns over negative factors and China's legitimate development rights being suppressed. Blinken emphasized the need for face-to-face diplomacy to address differences and avoid misunderstandings. The talks, which include closed-door meetings and a working lunch, come as tensions remain despite high-level exchanges and working groups on issues like trade and military communication.

images.alt_text: (FILES) This photograph taken in Mulhouse, eastern France on October 19, 2023, shows the logo of the social media video sharing app Tik Tok reflected in mirrors. The US Senate on Tuesday approved legislation requiring the wildly popular social media app TikTok to be divested from its Chinese parent company ByteDance or be shut out of the American market. The measure was part of a $95 billion foreign aid package, including military assistance to Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan, which has now cleared Congress and heads to President Joe Biden's desk. (Photo by SEBASTIEN BOZON / AFP)
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will press China to stop its firms from retooling and resupplying Russia’s defence industrial base.

site_title: Electrolux Q1 loss nearly triples on weak demand but beats expectations
summary: Electrolux reported a Q1 operating loss of 720 million kronor (S$90.07 million), nearly tripling from a year-earlier loss of 256 million kronor. The loss was smaller than expected due to easing raw material costs. The Swedish group, known for premium appliances, struggles to compete with lower-price rivals like China's Midea, as cash-strapped households opt for cheaper alternatives.

images.alt_text: The company reported a near eight per cent drop in sales to 33.4 billion kronor (S$4.09 billion) in the third quarter compared with the same period the previous year.

site_title: Hong Kong home prices rise for first time in 11 months after curbs scrapped
summary: Hong Kong home prices rose 1.06% in March, the first increase in 11 months, after the government removed property curbs. This rebound is short-lived, as analysts predict higher interest rates and oversupply of unsold apartments will weigh on the market. There are 20,000 completed but unsold apartments and 71,000 under construction, leading to downward adjustments in pricing. Home prices may fall 5-10% this year if the US Federal Reserve's rate cuts miss expectations, according to experts.

site_title: Gan Kim Yong visits US and Canada; to mark 20th anniversary of US-Singapore FTA
summary: Minister for Trade and Industry Gan Kim Yong is visiting the US and Canada from April 28 to May 3 to mark the 20th anniversary of the US-Singapore Free Trade Agreement. During his trip, he will engage with US and Canadian counterparts, attend a commemorative reception, and co-chair a joint committee meeting to review the agreement's implementation and discuss new areas of cooperation. The visit aims to deepen ties and promote bilateral trade and investment between the two countries.

images.alt_text: Members of the US-led Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF) at the Apec Summit in San Francisco.
US-China tensions “have serious consequences for the rest of the world,” Gan Kim Yong, Singapore minister for trade and industry said.

Mohamad Maliki Osman, Minister in the Prime Minister’s Office and Second Minister for Education and Foreign Affairs, and Gan Kim Yong, Minister for Trade and Industry representing Singapore at the Apec Ministerial Meeting in San Francisco.

site_title: Stocks to watch: CLI, Great Eastern, MIT, Sheng Siong, iFast, OUE, Far East Orchard
summary: Singapore stocks saw mixed performances on Friday, with CapitaLand Investment's Q1 revenue down 0.2% to S$650 million. Great Eastern's chairman appealed for patience amid declining shareholder returns, while the company plans to boost returns through a new dividend policy. Mapletree Industrial Trust posted a 0.9% rise in distribution per unit, while Sheng Siong's net profit rose 9.3% to S$36.3 million. iFast recorded a 387.4% spike in net profit to S$14.5 million, driven by its ePension business unit.

images.alt_text: Shares in Genting Singapore were  per cent lower after news that Malaysia is looking at opening a casino in Johor.

site_title: Mapletree Industrial Trust to distribute S$13 million of divestment gains over next 4 quarters
summary: Mapletree Industrial Trust (MIT) plans to distribute S$13 million of gains from divesting its Tanglin Halt Cluster over the next four quarters, following its sale at a S$50.6 million price, representing an 8.4% premium above book value. The trust's aggregate leverage ratio rose to 38.7% as of March 2024, while interest coverage ratio fell to 4.6 times. MIT aims to distribute the gains equally over the four quarters, starting from the next quarter.

images.alt_text: Unitholders of Mapletree Industrial Trust can expect to receive the distributable payout on Jun 10, with the book closure on May 6.

site_title: Precision and poise
summary: Watches and Wonders Geneva 2024 showcased the latest feminine timepieces, blending aesthetics and practicality. Cartier's Reflection de Cartier features a reflective dial with a gem-like bevelled glass, while Vacheron Constantin's Grand Lady Kalla boasts 146 emerald-cut diamonds. Hermès introduced the Cut, a 36mm sports watch with an integrated bracelet. Jaeger-LeCoultre updated its Master Ultra Thin Perpetual Calendar with a 70-hour power reserve. Patek Philippe commemorated the 25th anniversary of the Twenty~4 collection with a rose gold cuff-style timepiece.

site_title: Singapore’s growth should strengthen to ‘around potential rate’, output gap to close by end-2024: MAS
summary: Singapore's economy is expected to grow around its potential rate of 2-3% in 2024, with the negative output gap narrowing and closing by year-end, according to the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). Global economic growth remains resilient, driven by a strong US economy and improving momentum in China. MAS expects the Singapore economy to converge towards its pre-pandemic growth rates, with growth driven by the tech sector, trade-related industries, and a broad alignment of global macroeconomic, tech, and interest rate cycles.

images.alt_text: Singapore's economy grew 2.7 per cent year on year in the first quarter of 2024, improving from the previous quarter’s 2.2 per cent growth.
Generic image of shopper along Orchard Road
The central bank last adjusted its monetary policy stance in 2022.

site_title: Anglo rejects BHP takeover bid as significantly undervalued
summary: Anglo American, a 107-year-old miner, has rejected a $39 billion takeover proposal from BHP Group, citing the offer as significantly undervalued. The proposal, which includes spinning off Anglo's stakes in South African platinum and iron ore companies, was seen as below market value. Anglo chairman Stuart Chambers described the offer as "opportunistic" and "highly unattractive," creating uncertainty and execution risk. BHP will need to improve its offer to start talks, while a successful deal would give BHP a significant share of global copper mine supply ahead of an expected shortage.

site_title: Mixed trading in Asia as investors watch for further macro data; STI down 0.2%
summary: Singapore's Straits Times Index (STI) fell 0.2% to 3,280.10 points, while the broader market saw gainers outnumber losers 327 to 242 after 1.6 billion securities worth S$1.2 billion changed hands. Investors watched for further macroeconomic data, with persistent inflation weighing on concerns of higher-for-longer rates. In Asia, the Nikkei 225 gained 0.8%, the Hang Seng Index rose 2.1%, and the FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI increased 0.4%, while the IDX Composite Index fell 1.7%.

site_title: Money laundering accused Zhang Ruijin slapped with 5 more charges days before scheduled guilty plea
summary: Zhang Ruijin, a Chinese national, has been charged with eight counts of money laundering and forgery offenses in Singapore. He faces additional charges related to receiving allegedly laundered funds in his Standard Chartered Bank Singapore and CIMB Bank accounts, totaling S$9.9 million. Zhang is scheduled to plead guilty on April 30, while his alleged accomplice, Lin Baoying, faces three charges and is in remand. The case is part of Singapore's largest money laundering case, with over S$3 billion in assets seized or frozen, involving 10 foreign nationals.

images.alt_text: The 10 accused in the case.

Vang's charges ranged from allegedly possessing S$2.4 million in criminal benefits generated from unlicensed moneylending operations in China, to submitting a forged bank statement to Citibank Singapore.

site_title: UK consumer confidence improves as inflation and taxes fall
summary: UK consumer confidence has improved, rising to minus 19, up from minus 30 in April last year, as inflation fell to its lowest since 2021 and tax cuts took effect. The economy is recovering from last year's shallow recession, with consumers becoming more optimistic about the economic outlook and willing to spend. However, policymakers warn of the threat from persistent inflation, potentially fading hopes for early interest rate cuts.

images.alt_text: The figures underscore the pressure on the public finances as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak prepares for a general election later this year, possibly as early as October.
The UK is eyeing exports as a way to pull its economy out of a period of lacklustre growth.

Fintech companies in the UK say there is not enough investment coming from UK-based investors in particular.

site_title: South Korea’s public finances no longer a credit rating ‘strength’: Fitch
summary: Fitch Ratings downgraded South Korea's public finances from a credit rating 'strength' to a neutral factor, citing a rise in debt from 35.9% in 2018 to 51.4% in 2024. The agency expects the country's sovereign debt ratio to reach 53.6% by 2028, diverging from a downward trend forecast for "AA" rated countries. Fitch's Asia-Pacific director Jeremy Zook emphasized the need for near-term efforts to contain the rise in debt, particularly in light of ageing demographics and the liberal opposition party's proposal for a universal cash handout scheme.

images.alt_text: SK Hynix has been the sole supplier of HBM3 to Nvidia and began mass production of the latest version of HBM chips, called HBM3E.
South Korea expects its economic growth to accelerate to more than 2 per cent this year, as exports continue to advance.

site_title: India rice prices at three-month low on shrinking demand
summary: India's rice export prices have fallen to a three-month low due to subdued demand and ample supplies. The prices, which were quoted at US$528-536 per tonne, are down from a record high of US$560 last month. India imposed a 20% export duty on parboiled rice exports in August 2023 to control domestic rice prices. Meanwhile, Vietnam's prices remained largely flat, and Thailand's prices remained steady. The slowdown in purchases by domestic rice processors in Vietnam has put downward pressure on domestic paddy rice prices.

images.alt_text: Indonesia has imported 3.1 million tonnes of grain in 2023, close to a record.
India’s 5 per cent broken parboiled variety was quoted at record US$546-to-US$554 per tonne this week, up from the last week’s US$542-to-US$550.
Parboiled rice is the result of a process that involves partial boiling of paddy before milling to boost its nutritional values and change the texture of cooked rice.

site_title: ByteDance prefers TikTok shutdown in US if legal options fail: sources
summary: ByteDance, the owner of TikTok, prefers to shut down the app in the US rather than sell it if legal options to fight a ban fail. The company's core algorithms are deemed essential to its operations, making a sale unlikely. A shutdown would have limited impact on ByteDance's business, allowing it to retain its core intellectual property. TikTok's US business accounts for a small share of ByteDance's total revenues and daily active users. ByteDance has expressed opposition to a forced sale of TikTok, with China indicating it would reject such a move.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: U.S. flag and TikTok logos are seen in this illustration taken, April 24, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

site_title: Gold prices set for weekly decline ahead of US inflation data
summary: Gold prices are expected to decline this week due to US inflation data, which will influence the Federal Reserve's interest rate trajectory. Spot gold fell 0.1% to $2,331.15 per ounce, and US gold futures remained unchanged at $2,343.50 per ounce. Top consumer China's net gold imports jumped 40% in March, but higher interest rates reduce gold's appeal. The US economy grew at its slowest pace in nearly two years, reinforcing expectations of no interest rate cut before September.

images.alt_text: Spot gold was flat at US$2,317.03 per ounce.

site_title: Rescue pup to meme star: the real-life ‘Dogecoin’ dog
summary: Kabosu, a Japanese shiba inu, has become an internet celebrity after her picture was posted on a blog in 2010, inspiring the "Doge" meme and a US$23 billion cryptocurrency, Dogecoin. The meme, featuring Kabosu's enigmatic smile, was created from an online forum post and has been used in various forms of media, including NFTs and merchandise. Kabosu's owner, Atsuko Sato, has been surprised by her dog's fame but has connected with fans through charity donations and meet-and-greets. Despite health issues, Kabosu remains a beloved figure, with fans hoping her "legend lives on" after her passing.

site_title: Japanese yen slides back towards 34-year low after brief spike
summary: The Japanese yen slid to its weakest level in nearly 16 years, reaching 156.82 per dollar, before briefly jumping to 154.97 and then falling 0.66% to 156.67. The brief spike left traders on high alert for possible intervention by the Bank of Japan, which kept interest rates on hold. The yen's 11% drop against the dollar this year is the largest of any G10 currency, driven by a wide gap between US and Japanese government bond yields. The Bank of Japan's decision did not provide clear guidance on future policy, fueling market uncertainty.

images.alt_text: As widely expected, the Bank of Japan maintained its short-term interest rate target at a range of 0-0.1 per cent in a unanimous vote.
The core consumer price index in Tokyo, a leading indicator of nationwide figures, increased 1.6 per cent in April from a year earlier, slowing from a 2.4 per cent gain in March.
Early on Friday, one dollar bought 155.58 yen, compared with 155.74 the previous day - a level not seen since 1990.
Toyota, the world’s largest carmaker by volume, will include technology from tech giant Tencent technology in a China-made passenger vehicle that will go on sale this year.
Daiwa has sought to shift its focus away from generating commissions in its traditional brokerage business to focus instead on its wealth management services.
The US dollar index was last up 0.2 per cent at 105.85 after earlier touching the lowest since Apr 12 at 105.59.

site_title: Bank of Japan keeps rates steady, projects inflation staying near 2% in coming years
summary: The Bank of Japan maintained its short-term interest rate target at 0-0.1% in a unanimous vote, keeping rates steady. The central bank projects inflation to stay near 2% in the next three years, with forecasts of 1.9% in the current fiscal year and 2.1% in 2026. This decision follows the end of eight years of negative rates and a historic shift away from massive monetary stimulus. The move signals the BOJ's readiness to hike borrowing costs later this year.

site_title: Singapore Management University opens new centre in Vietnam, plans three more in the region by 2030
summary: Singapore Management University (SMU) has launched its third overseas centre in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, as part of its efforts to expand its regional reach. The centre aims to increase collaboration with local partners in education and industry, enhance human capital development, and facilitate knowledge exchange between Vietnam and other Asean countries. SMU plans to launch three more representative offices across Asia by 2030, following encouraging results from its existing centres in Jakarta and Bangkok.

images.alt_text: Since 2023, many tutoring firms that have gone international have strengthened their offline offerings to keep up with demand and cut costs.
Isca aims to sponsor 4,000 students, with S$5 million set aside for this, says Isca president Teo Ser Luck.

site_title: Meta’s earnings flop sparks US$400 billion sell-off in tech stocks
summary: Meta's disappointing earnings report has led to a $400 billion sell-off in tech stocks, with the Nasdaq 100 Index falling 2% and Meta's shares plummeting 16%. The company forecast weaker-than-expected sales for the current quarter, raising questions about returns on investments in artificial intelligence. Analysts see this as a buying opportunity, citing Meta's high market capitalization and potential for future growth. Despite the sell-off, some investors believe the company's AI strategy could ultimately lead to cost savings and increased user benefits.

images.alt_text: While Zuckerberg's track record is good, there is a lingering problem with the “metaverse,” a bet that has shown only minimal signs of bringing good results.
Meta’s latest technology is being rolled out in more than a dozen English-speaking countries, including Australia, Canada, Singapore and the United States.
The move will allow partner companies to build their headsets using Meta Horizon OS, a rebranded operating system.
Big tech is crucial to the S&P 500 since the companies carry the heaviest weightings in the benchmark.

site_title: Hong Kong bourse regains favour on hopes of a market revival
summary: Hong Kong's stock exchange, HKEX, is experiencing its best week in years after China's pledge to boost liquidity and solid earnings beats. The stock has surged 16% this week, driven by mainland funds buying into Hong Kong equities and China's plans to encourage companies to list in the financial hub. Analysts predict continued momentum in income and a broader re-rating of market valuation, with Goldman Sachs forecasting a bottoming out in average daily turnover in the first half.

images.alt_text: Laura Cha has reached the two-term limit but will remain an independent director of Chinese fintech giant Ant Group and a top trading policy advisor for Hong Kong and Beijing.

site_title: OUE wins tender to lease, develop new ‘zero-energy’ hotel at Changi Airport’s T2
summary: OUE Limited won a tender to lease and develop a new 255-key 'zero-energy' hotel, Hotel Indigo Changi Airport, at Changi Airport's Terminal 2 (T2). The hotel, set to be completed by 2028, will feature a 'floating forest' concept and achieve operational energy neutrality through on-site solar energy generation and energy-efficient design. The 58-year strata sublease, awarded by Changi Airport Group (CAG), will be valid until August 29, 2083. The project is expected to have no material impact on OUE's consolidated net tangible assets or earnings per share for the current fiscal year.

images.alt_text: Changi Airport Group (CAG) said that the airport handled about 5.4 million passengers movements each in January and February, and around 5.7 million passenger movements in March.

site_title: China firms are investing abroad at fastest pace in eight years
summary: China's overseas investment surged to an eight-year high in the first quarter, reaching 243 billion yuan (S$45.6 billion) in foreign direct investments. The growth is driven by Chinese firms in industries where China is racing ahead of rivals, such as electric vehicles and solar energy. This shift aims to reduce trade tensions and overcapacity by creating jobs and economic growth in overseas markets. However, investment from China may not always be welcome due to geopolitical competition, with a "huge suspicion" against Chinese investments in the US and Europe.

images.alt_text: Beijing has announced plans to step up central government spending as an offset.
Kering warned of a sharp decline in first-half profits, attributing it to weak demand in Asia, especially China, and challenges with revitalizing Gucci.
Destinations that have either waived the visa process for Chinese citizens or are offering electronic visas on arrival include Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, and the Middle East and North Africa.
The average coupon in April on new debt fell to just 2.83 per cent – the lowest level in data going back to 1999.

site_title: Beijing city to subsidise domestic AI chips, targets self-reliance by 2027
summary: Beijing city authorities have announced subsidies for domestic AI chip purchases, aiming for 100% self-reliance in smart computing infrastructure by 2027. The subsidies, targeting companies that use domestically produced chips, are seen as a response to the US tightening restrictions on exporting advanced computing products to China. The move follows China's cultivation of its own AI chip industry, with Huawei's Ascend 910 chips being a potential alternative to US rival Nvidia's products. This initiative aims to reduce reliance on foreign technology and promote domestic semiconductor development.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Figurines with computers and smartphones are seen in front of the words "Artificial Intelligence AI" in this illustration taken, February 19, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

site_title: CapitaLand Investment posts total revenue of S$650 million for Q1
summary: CapitaLand Investment posted total revenue of S$650 million for the first quarter of 2024, down 0.2% from the same period last year. The real estate investment manager reported stable performance on a year-on-year basis, with fee-income-related business revenue growing 7% to S$274 million. The company's real estate investment business revenue fell 4% to S$430 million, largely due to asset divestments and lower revenue from its lodging platform. CapitaLand aims to achieve funds under management of S$200 billion by 2028.

images.alt_text: The CapitaLand logo on the facade of Funan Centre.

site_title: Oil settles higher as weak US economic growth offset by supply concerns
summary: Oil prices rose 1.1% on Thursday as supply concerns outweighed weak US economic growth data. Brent crude futures settled at $89.01 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures rose 9% to $83.57. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the US economy is performing well, despite weaker-than-expected quarterly growth data, and inflation is expected to ease. Despite concerns over fuel demand, US petrol and distillate stockpiles rose, and crude inventories unexpectedly fell last week.

images.alt_text: In a joint statement it was confirmed Aramco would become Fifa’s Major Worldwide Partner exclusive in the energy category.
Brent crude futures fell 40 US cents, or 0.45 per cent, to settle at US$88.02 a barrel.

site_title: Singapore office rents in central region fall 1.7 per cent in Q1 after rising for 9 quarters
summary: Singapore's office rental index for the central region fell 1.7% in Q1 2024, after rising for 9 consecutive quarters. The islandwide vacancy rate decreased to 9.6% despite a contraction of 96,900 sq ft in occupied office space. This drop is attributed to landlords adjusting rental expectations to maximize occupancy rates amid slower-than-expected office leasing demand.

site_title: Huawei’s new phone sports latest version of made-in-China chip
summary: Huawei's new Pura 70 series smartphone features the Kirin 9010 processor, a newer version of the chip made by China's Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation (SMIC) using its 7nm N+2 process. This move underscores Huawei's ability to produce advanced semiconductor manufacturing despite US technology export curbs. The chip's development could further pressure the iPhone market, particularly in China, where Huawei has seen a resurgence in market share. The Kirin 9010 processor is a significant step for Huawei in rebuilding its consumer business after Trump-era sanctions.

site_title: Meituan to debut in Riyadh as expansion beyond China quickens
summary: Meituan, a Chinese food delivery company, is set to launch its international platform in Saudi Arabia's capital, Riyadh, marking its first move outside of greater China. The company's expansion comes as growth slows in its home market and follows a successful launch in Hong Kong in 2023. Meituan will compete with local rivals, including Jahez International and Uber-backed Careem, and may employ a subsidy-heavy strategy to draw in users and delivery workers. The move is part of a broader push by Chinese companies to expand into the Middle East, where they see less political scrutiny.

images.alt_text: Meituan reported sales of 73.7 billion yuan (S$13.8 billion) in the December quarter, versus the 72.7 billion yuan average projection.
DBS notes that Foodpanda business is a sub-scale business for Meituan, relieving stress on Grab's counter.
Meituan reports June-September revenue of 76.47 billion yuan (S$14.3 billion), versus 62.62 billion yuan in the same period a year earlier.
Founded in 2010, Meituan has become the largest food delivery platform in China.

site_title: Spotify says Apple has rejected its app update with price information for EU users
summary: Spotify's iOS app update with in-app pricing information for EU users was rejected by Apple, the company said. The update was submitted in response to the European Commission's ruling, which requires streaming services to inform users of payment options outside the App Store. Spotify refused to include the in-app link, citing concerns over a 27% commission on transactions made through links. Apple will approve the update if Spotify accepts the terms of the Music Streaming Services Entitlement, which includes anti-steering restrictions and the commission fee.

site_title: Chinese sellers go to TikTok school to reach buyers abroad
summary: Chinese sellers are turning to TikTok to reach buyers abroad, despite the app being blocked in China. A two-week course at an e-commerce school in Guangzhou teaches students how to sell products on TikTok, covering topics such as creating a TikTok account, handling shipping, and analyzing sales data. Fees start at around $1,690 for a six-day course. As the US Congress considers banning TikTok due to concerns over data sharing with the Chinese government, many Chinese sellers see the app as a key opportunity to cut out the middleman and market themselves directly to overseas consumers.

images.alt_text: China indicated it would be likely to reject a forced divestment of the TikTok app during a US congressional hearing in March last year.

The measure was part of a $95 billion foreign aid package, including military assistance to Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan, which has now cleared Congress and heads to President Joe Biden's desk. “Rest assured – we aren’t going anywhere. The facts and the Constitution are on our side and we expect to prevail again,” TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew says.

TikTok has rivalled larger companies such as Meta Platforms for user attention and ad budgets, and its cultural power is reflected in its ability to catapult emerging artists into viral hits, changing how young people discover music.

site_title: Roku’s warning on ad-supported streaming competition clouds upbeat earnings
summary: Roku reported strong quarterly earnings, with net revenue of $881.5 million and a 19% increase in revenue from its platform segment. However, the company warned that growing competition from ad-supported streaming services, including major players like Netflix, could weigh on its growth this year. Roku faces "difficult year-over-year growth rate comparisons" due to past price increases and a higher mix shift towards ad-supported offerings, sending its shares down 3% in extended trading. The company forecasts second-quarter revenue above estimates.

site_title: Basel Committee adds climate risks to banking supervision standards
summary: The Basel Committee has updated its banking supervision guidelines to include climate risks and the digitalisation of finance. The changes were approved by 220 central bankers and financial regulators in Basel, Switzerland, following a review launched in 2022. The update aims to reflect recent crises, such as the Covid-19 pandemic and bank failures, and strengthen operational resilience to withstand various shocks, including natural disasters and cyber incidents.

site_title: HDB resale prices accelerate, rising 1.8% in Q1 on stronger demand
summary: HDB resale prices in Singapore rose 1.8% in Q1 2024, the fastest quarterly increase since Q3 2022, driven by stronger demand. Resale transactions increased 8% to 7,068 cases, while overall prices rose 40% since Q1 2020. Larger flats are in high demand, and private property owners are opting for public housing. Market analysts expect resale prices to rise 3-6% in 2024, with rental demand for HDB flats slowing down due to moderating private rents.

images.alt_text: The house Liqian Ma, is buying has a long driveway.
S$16.5 million deal at The Ritz-Carlton Residences tops Q1 gainers; seller reaps S$4.9 million profit
A S$10.4 million guide price has been set for a 5,554 sq ft space at Block 210 New Upper Changi Road near Bedok MRT station.

The gap between asking and transacted rents has narrowed, as landlords adjust their expectations to align with market conditions and tenant affordability, said Lee Nai Jia, PropertyGuru head of real estate intelligence, data and software solutions.
Rental volumes for both condo and HDB flats recover in March after falling in February.

site_title: Snap beats first-quarter expectations, shares jump 25%
summary: Snapchat's parent company beat analyst expectations for first-quarter revenue and user growth, with daily active users reaching 422 million. Revenue rose 21% to $1.2 billion, driven by improvements to its advertising system and higher demand for features that help brands drive sales. Shares jumped 25% to $14.32. Snap forecasts a strong second quarter, expecting revenue between $1.23 billion and $1.26 billion.

TikTok’s US expansion has already attracted the attention of politicians and regulators, who fret about the company’s growing influence over its audience.
Snap has been using the service to roll out early access to new features and improve them based on user feedback.

site_title: S&P slashes Boeing credit outlook as rating hovers above junk status
summary: S&P has downgraded Boeing's credit outlook to "negative" from "stable", citing increased potential for further delays in cash flow and credit ratios due to production uncertainty and quality issues affecting the 737 MAX aircraft. Moody's cut Boeing's credit rating to one notch above junk status on Wednesday, and the company faces regulatory scrutiny after a mid-air cabin panel blowout. S&P expects Boeing to not generate sufficient free cash flow to cover debt maturities in 2024, and flags concerns around leadership uncertainty.

images.alt_text: Boeing says its first-quarter cash burn, a metric closely watched by investors, was US$3.9 billion, compared with negative US$786 million a year ago.
The fuselage plug area of Alaska Airlines Flight 1282 Boeing 737-9 MAX which was forced to make an emergency landing with a gap in the fuselage, Jan 7, 2024.

site_title: Singapore shares open lower on Friday; STI down 0.1%
summary: Singapore stocks declined at the opening bell on Friday, tracking overnight losses in global markets. The Straits Times Index (STI) fell 3.93 points or 0.1% to 3,283.82, with losers outnumbering gainers 62 to 45. Seatrium was the most heavily traded counter, down 2.3%, while Yangzijiang Shipbuilding dipped 1.7%. Banking stocks, however, saw gains, with DBS up 0.4%, OCBC 0.1%, and UOB trading flat. Global markets were also affected, with the Nasdaq Composite Index shedding 0.6% and the S&P 500 dipping 0.5%.

images.alt_text: CapitaLand Investment posts a total revenue of S$650 million for Q1, down 0.2 per cent from the previous year.

site_title: Private home prices ease to 1.4% rise in Q1; rents fall a further 1.9%
summary: Singapore's private housing prices rose 1.4% in Q1 2024, the slowest quarterly gain since 2021, as demand moderates and housing stock increases. Rents fell 1.9% in Q1, extending the 2.1% decline in the previous quarter. Analysts attribute the slowdown to economic uncertainty and higher interest rates. The unsold inventory of uncompleted units jumped 17.8% in Q1, while sales volume was down 2.4% for the third straight quarter. Analysts expect rents to further ease in the coming months, with some predicting a 5% fall this year.

site_title: Crypto firm sues SEC to fend off oversight of Ethereum
summary: Crypto firm Consensys sued the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to fend off regulation of the Ethereum blockchain and its digital token Ether. The lawsuit claims the SEC's oversight would "crippling one of the internet's greatest innovations." Consensys argues that Ether is not a security and is seeking a court ruling to support its claim. This move comes amid growing scrutiny of Ethereum by the SEC, which has demanded information from various companies as part of a review of Ether.

images.alt_text: Hong Kong is set to be Asia’s first to accept cryptocurrency products as a mainstream investment tool, and the products have also received official regulatory approval from the Securities and Futures Commission.

site_title: Reaching a utopia where heart attacks become a rarity
summary: New guidelines focus on lowering LDL cholesterol to prevent heart disease, emphasizing the importance of reducing cholesterol levels. Statins are the first-choice cholesterol-lowering drug, which can reduce LDL cholesterol by 50% or more. However, they may not be suitable for everyone, especially those with liver or kidney issues. Alternative options, such as ezetimibe and new injectable cholesterol-lowering agents like PCSK9 inhibitors and inclisiran, can also be effective. These new treatments offer a good safety profile and can be used in conjunction with statins and/or ezetimibe to achieve optimal LDL cholesterol levels, potentially leading to a utopia where heart attacks become a rarity.

site_title: Europe: Stocks retreat on earnings gloom, weak US economic data
summary: Europe's Stoxx 600 index closed 0.7% lower on Thursday, following a global stocks rout, amid weak earnings from Nestle and Adyen, and weak US economic data. The US economy grew at its slowest pace in nearly two years, with inflation concerns reinforcing expectations of a Federal Reserve rate hike. Despite sectoral declines, some European stocks bucked the trend, including Sabadell and Deutsche Bank, while Britain's FTSE 100 reached a record high.

images.alt_text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished at 38,085.73 on Thursday, down 1.0 per cent but about 330 points above its session low.

site_title: Airbus net profit soars 28% in first quarter
summary: Airbus reported a 28% increase in first-quarter net income to 595 million euros, driven by rising deliveries and growing production. Revenue grew 9% to 12.8 billion euros, with 142 commercial planes delivered in the quarter. Despite this, the company expects to deliver 800 passenger planes this year, below 863 in 2019. Airbus has an order backlog of 8,626 planes, with plans to increase production rates for its A320 and A350 models.

images.alt_text: The airline signed a firm deal for 30 A350-900 jets, with purchase rights for an additional 70 “ for possible future needs.

site_title: Inflation in Japan’s capital falls below BOJ target, slows for second month
summary: Japan's core consumer price index in Tokyo slowed to 1.6% in April from a year earlier, falling below the Bank of Japan's 2% target for the second consecutive month. This reading complicates the central bank's decision on interest rate hikes. The core CPI, excluding fresh food and fuel costs, also slowed to 1.8% in April, the slowest pace since September 2022. The slowdown highlights uncertainty on whether consumption and wage pressure will sustain price growth around the 2% target.

Service price moves are closely watched by the Bank of Japan as a key indicator of whether wages and inflation are rising in tandem, which it set as one of the prerequisites for raising interest rates.
Early on Friday, one dollar bought 155.58 yen, compared with 155.74 the previous day - a level not seen since 1990.

site_title: Intel slides after tepid forecast spurs fears about comeback
summary: Intel reported earnings for the first time under a new business structure, showing the financial performance of its manufacturing operations. The chipmaker forecast sales of $13 billion for the second quarter, below analyst estimates, and predicted a profit of 10 cents per share. This signals that Intel's efforts to revive its business under CEO Pat Gelsinger will take more time and money, as the company lags behind rivals like Nvidia and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. Intel shares fell 7.2% in extended trading after the report.

images.alt_text: TSMC is the world’s biggest contract manufacturer of advanced computing chips and a key supplier to Nvidia and Apple.
Intel has now switched over to using EUV tools, which will cover more and more production needs as older machines are phased out.
The US has been aiming to boost domestic semiconductor output and reduce reliance on China and Taiwan with the Biden administration’s 2022 Chips and Science Act.
The package will support more than US$100 billion in US investments from Intel, including efforts to produce cutting-edge semiconductors at large-scale plants in Arizona and Ohio.

site_title: BTS agency files complaint against subsidiary head over breach of trust
summary: HYBE, the agency behind K-pop sensation BTS, has filed a complaint against Min Hee-jin, the chief of its subsidiary label ADOR, alleging breach of trust in business. Min denied the accusations, claiming she has "no interest" in management rights and was merely trying to protect her girl group NewJeans from copying by another subsidiary. HYBE claims to have physical evidence of Min's alleged plan to seize management rights and has urged her to resign.

images.alt_text: Min Hee-jin, famed superproducer and chief of ADOR, a powerhouse subsidiary of HYBE, speaks during a press conference in Seoul on April 25, 2024.
